ELI5: How can a person see a skewed image of themselves in the mirror?
WRITING.TEXT:
I've been searching for the explanation of how people see skewed versions of themselves in mirrors for a while.
I have an eating disorder and am currently in recovery and weigh 128 lbs and am 5'5. When I look in the mirror all I can see is how fat my legs are. How big my arms are. How big my face is.
But when I tell others, they say I'm not seeing what is really there.
How is that possible? How are MY eyes different from other people's?

WRITING.TITLE: Apparently I have some "manly" mannerisms. What are some otherwise "manly" things you do?
WRITING.TEXT:
My coworker pointed out that I apparently swear too much and am not girly so therefore I have very manly mannerisms.
I laughed and told him to go fuck himself.
What are some "manly"things you do without noticing?
